messages.subject: Re: Laundry...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 09/21/2001 10:12:35 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Julian does all our laundry. Doesn t fold, though, but not having to trek up and down the
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 09/21/2001 10:12:35 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> Since having both kids at home all the time there seems to be a never ending
> stream of laundry either waiting to be done, waiting to go in the dryer,
> waiting to be folded, waiting to be put away..... Plus more and more
> housework, which I cannot possib.y keep up with. The first order of
> business
> next week is to get a cleaner. I told hubby if we were not going to be
> paying $600 per month for Waldorf we could definately afford a $50 cleaner
> once every 2 weeks. He agreed.
>
>

Julian does all our laundry. Doesn't fold, though, but not having to trek up
and down the stairs to the basement is wonderful. We have a wonderful cleaner
named Rosa. Once every two weeks we have to de-clutter a little so she can
clean, then we go away for a few hours. When we come back the place is
cleaner than I'd ever do it, and it smells good. We just love her. :)

Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
